definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Simple opinions on school-based curriculum development.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族中学校本课程开发的浅见。

sentences.english: Of course, this is only a humble opinion.
May I offer my two cents on this matter?
sentences.chinese: 对这件事，我能表达一些浅见吗？

sentences.english: Let me give my humble option.
sentences.chinese: 我来说一下我的浅见吧。

sentences.english: Some humble opinions on how to strengthen the clean government in the fire inspection are talked about.
sentences.chinese: 现对消防监督工作中如何加强廉政建设谈一些浅见。

sentences.english: I cannot have a complete understanding of the problem with my poor opinion and shallow learning.
sentences.chinese: 以我的浅见薄识是无法全面理解这个问题的。

sentences.english: Its effect is very good and it will be of the opinion written for communicate.
sentences.chinese: 因其效果甚佳，故将不才的浅见写下，以供交流。

sentences.english: In the article, the author puts forward his personal views only on the method of separating load between cable and beam.
sentences.chinese: 本文仅就其中的索梁分载法提出些个人浅见。

sentences.english: This, IMHO, is smart and helps us out, too.
sentences.chinese: 以我的浅见来说，这很聪明，而且也帮助了我们。

sentences.english: So, ask everyone to see me to the shallow view of" the modern educates the technique".
sentences.chinese: 那么，请大家看看我对“现代教育技术”的浅见。

sentences.english: Use what format to weave etc, offer oneself superficial view.
sentences.chinese: 采用什么格式来编制等，提出自己的浅见。

sentences.english: Let me give my humble opinion.
sentences.chinese: 我来颁发一下我的浅见。

definition: my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
to venture to/to presume to/to take the liberty of
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
to just talk for the sake of talking
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
lit. a brick thrown to prompt others to produce a jade (idiom)/fig. a modest suggestion intended to prompt others to come forward with better ideas
to point out mistakes or weak points for correction/to comment/criticism
to jump to an unfounded conclusion
